intro: Laserpitium athamantae, commonly known as the alpine hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the European Alps. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in harsh, mountainous environments. Its yellow ray florets and dark brown disk florets make it visually distinctive. Laserpitium athamantae is adapted to cold climates and is often found in alpine meadows and scree slopes.
